Reviews.Title: “Not really good for disabled”
Reviews.Author: future_ice
Reviews.Content: The disabled parking is at the front of the hotel, then they send you on what feels like a never ending walk to your room. When you get there the room is nothing special. Good job the bath is deep because you'll need it!. Serves its purpose. Wouldn't want an extended stay. It's just an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wnydham Indy West”
Reviews.Author: taf45377
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility. The breakfast for the price was a bit skimpy but the service was great. We stayed there over the weekend and the first morning we woke up no hot water in the whole hotel. They tried to make it right by offering free breakfast for that day. Hot water was restore by mid-afternoon. The room was great. The hotel was easy to find just off the expressway. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy night”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I reserved a "standard double" room through Travelocity. When I checked in, the hotel staff gave me a parlor or meeting room with a Murphy bed. Two problems: First, the Murphy bed was stuck and would not come down from the wall. I had to call for someone from maintenance to get it unstuck. When the bed finally came out of the wall, only the box springs came down. The maintenance guy then pulled down the mattress and finally the sheets and comforter. He told me that he didn't make up beds and that I would have to wait for someone from housekeeping to come make up the bed. The housekeeping supervisor made up the bed but told me they had other rooms available and took me back to the front desk to ask for another room. They moved me to a "standard double" room like the one I had originally reserved. Second problem was that the room was hot--about 80 degrees--and neither the maintenance guy nor the housekeeping supervisor could figure out how to change the temperature on the thermostat. Even my new room had a couple of problems. First, the phone was dead. When I used my cell phone to call the extension listed for "room service" on the printed materials in the room, I was told that that was the wrong number for room service. It was the number for the cafe, but they did not accept room service orders.

Reviews.Title: “would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wrktravelr
Reviews.Content: One of the first things I noticed was that there was trash in both trash cans in my room. The bathmat was fraying on one side, with threads hanging off the side. The shower curtain was filthy and disgusting and had holes in it. Closet door broken, toilet runs for 20 minutes as the tank fills very slowly. There was a washcloth missing, and I found it, used and wadded up -underneath the sink counter in the bathroom. It gave me the feeling that they do not clean their rooms here. The bedsheets were threadbare. No way I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “World's best beds”
Reviews.Author: MediaKath
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in November. I usually have a hard time sleeping through the night, but here I slept perfectly and woke up rested. The beds not only have wonderful downy duvets as comforters, but they also have feather beds between the mattress and sheets AND fabulous pillows, both hard and soft. I sunk into a heavenly cloud each night I went to bed and bought myself a feather bed for home when I left! BTW, our group had at least 100 teenagers buying Starbucks each morning, but it was handled quickly and cheerfully by staffers.

Reviews.Title: “all good”
Reviews.Author: scooby-BTR
Reviews.Content: I booked this establishment for a course. we booked a large room with seating for 75. also reserved their facility for lunch service. they did a excellent job with the lunch. had about 35 rooms booked, all my clientèle was pleased. we also booked a room to have for a meet and greet... again, great. food at restaurant was fine. there business center is a little bit to be desired as I needed to do some printing, and it was inconvenient. ended up sending someone in the morning to print some stuff

Reviews.Title: “Just Another Hotel Really”
Reviews.Author: Coasterfan95
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November 2011 as part of a conference. Compared to other Wyndham's this one seemed to be lacking the full quality. The exterior is old looking, and almost as if it were a buisness park. The front lobby was small, and being with a large group of people made it even smaller. Also when we all came into the lobby, we were sent out into the cold by either a manager or front desk worker. They said there was not enough room, and until everything was set we would have to wait out there. After waiting for approximatley 45 minutes out in the 40 degree weather, our room accommodations we finished. The rooms seemed small, and the bathroom was extremely tiny! However, the beds were pretty comfortable, and the tv was nice. One disadvantage from being inside center city was the loss of a view. All we saw (and heard) was the traffic outside the window. The small coffee shop was nice in the front lobby, as that is where we ordered breakfast most days. During our stay it looked like there was remodeling going on, which in many parts of the hotel seemed necessary. The rooms on the other hand were pretty modern, and recently updated. They were also very clean, and the maids did a very nice job of tidying up the place. The wireless internet and plug in on the fourth floor was very slow, as it took me around 2 hours to watch a video and check my email. My advice for the hotel would be to give the outside a facelift or atleast a coat of paint, and have the staff a little more courteous when it comes to handling big groups of people. Also invest in some new wireless routers, or a speedier internet service for those on business trips.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Suprise”
Reviews.Author: RexGermanorium
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in October 2011 as part of a conference. After booking it someone told me that it had gotten some poor ratings. But I was happily suprised to receive a very nice room, quite clean, with everthing working as it is suppose to. The conference went quite well and from my view point there were no problems. I didn't hear anyone complaining. I had breakfast in their restaurant and it was quite good, service was good as well. We did have some problems with the sound system when our conference got together in the large hall. The evening banquet was good, food was above average for these sort of conferences. It was strange though no coffee was served. It wasn't just our table either, I was scouting around for a pot, but didn't see anything. check-out was a breeze and uneventful. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dc8Louisville
Reviews.Content: nice room, bar and restaurant, I thought $15.95 each for a pasta/ pizza buffet was a bit much, but it was tasty and quick so no biggie. Some of the reviews say the hotel is old, but I think it looks pretty modern.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: Lodget
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty old - the rooms have that aged smell. The rooms' air conditioning is bad. My room had no electrical outlets. So I had to unplug some of my lights to plug my laptop and other chargers. They also had a water outage one day and in the evening when the water was restored, only muddy water came through the faucets. The American breakfast served in the restaurant was okay. The plus sides in this hotel are the free Internet and has free airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “What a Surprise Letdown !”
Reviews.Author: KennyFliesHigh
Reviews.Content: First, the positive - the staff was nice, friendly, and courteous. They run a free shuttle back and forth to the airport. Unfortunately, that is all I can say positive, as the negatives kept coming out. Upon check in the clerk reminded me that the heated pool was open until 10pm. At 8 that night the door to the pool was locked, and a hotel employee said they "think" they are emptying it. The water from my sink and tub ran with a brown hue for 20 minutes until the water cleared up (no wonder they leave water bottles in the bathroom). The room guide states you will get a morning paper. First day - no morning paper but a stack was by the elevators. Second day - no stack by the elevators - had to go to front desk to find stack there. Soda machine only had one selection left in stock. Six TV stations didn't work and three were snowy. I stayed on the 4th floor. When I opened my shades all I saw were the tops of trees - no view at all. Ice maker had a sign "broken use ice makers on 3rd and 5th floors". Those didn't work either. Neither did the ones on the 2nd and 6th floors - I had to trek all the way to the bar and ask for ice (just this fact alone ensures I will never stay there again - I was attending a rather large convention in town and I am sure the hotel was near capacity - this should not have been an issue). Overall it is a business class hotel, which is what I expected, but not worth the business class charge per night I paid. I have stayed at many other business class hotels that were actually within walking distance of ANYTHING (you need transportation to get ANYWHERE from this location) that out performed this place for less than what I paid. Stay here only as a last resort. HA HA. Resort. Get it?

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, economical, and fairly close to dragstrip”
Reviews.Author: sunfalcon
Reviews.Content: Hello! We recently stayed at this hotel during our annual visit to the NHRA US Nationals in Indianapolis. This hotel is located in the area of the old abandoned Indy Airport area. You can tell its hey-day is past, however, it is still a decent hotel. The pool is old, and has no area less than 4ft deep - not good for small children. The rooms were comfortable and the bed was very nice. It is a fairly large hotel with a big conference area. I'm not very picky when it comes to hotels and I don't go over everything with a fine tooth comb. I'm sure there are areas that this hotel could do better on, however, for the price we paid, it seemed clean and was a very good value. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Ann Marie T
Reviews.Content: Front desk help and concierge were both very helpful and kind. The room was spotless. The mattress was so wonderful, I'd like to have one at home! Parking was a bit far from our room, but we were able to easily locate a luggage cart to help get our suitcases up to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, it's a Wyndham...”
Reviews.Author: RetireeTraveler33715
Reviews.Content: and I expected it to be nice. And it was. And the amenities downstairs (24 hr coffee shop, etc) were nice. And we got a great weekend rate through a Priceline bid. But it felt like it was struggling to maintain it's rep, to live up to the name. Nothing bad, just...Put it this way: if I'd paid more than $115 a night, I would have felt like we could have done better.

Reviews.Title: “I would not pay more than $50 for a room.”
Reviews.Author: mewowz
Reviews.Content: We booked on Hotwire. The carpet was stained, the room smelled smoky, the size of the room and bathroom were quite small, the closet was missing a door, it is very noisy, the pool area wasn't very exciting but the pool itself was large. The food/drinks were expensive but what we had was pretty good. I liked the 24hour Starbucks but $2 for water was kind of ridiculous. They left us bottled water in the room the first night but never replaced it. The bed was too soft to do anything but sleep on and even that wasn't that great. The TV barely gets any channels and none of my favorites. We had trouble getting our door to open and our TV to turn on. No fridge, but all that granite? Geez. The wifi was very slow. I will never understand why "higher rated" hotels don't have a free continental breakfast. Someone kept stealing our "Do Not Disturb" sign and the maid bothered us every single morning except the last when I used our breakfast order card instead. And this may be dumb, but an employee in the coffee shop attempted to be humorous by telling us our card was declined. I just felt it was tacky. Housekeeping did do a good job in our rooms, however.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler020
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham because of a good deal through Expedia (Expedia special rate where you don't see the name of the hotel until you have reserved it). I would not have chosen this hotel myself primarily because of all the poor reviews. I checked in on a late afternoon on a Sunday and left early in the a.m. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I had a similar rate (60.00 total for the night) Pro's: Bed was comfortable, nice shower, I was next to the elevator but was not bothered by noise, nice big flat-screen T.V., Bath and Body Works spa shampoo/conditioner, etc., 24 hour bistro for coffee, pastries, soft drinks, very acceptable restaurant - had a great sandwich, shuttle to airport. Con's: furniture is worn and dated, used wash rag hanging in the bathroom. I asked the hotel clerk what time I should catch the shuttle for an 8:00 a.m. flight and she told me 7:00 a.m., that it would take 15 minutes to the airport. I think that is cutting it close and took the 6:30 a.m. shuttle. I was in the lobby by 6:15 and asked the clerk if the shuttle driver would come inside the lobby to get passengers and she said he "should" come in the lobby. At 6:25 I went outside to wait and saw several other people already waiting for the shuttle. The shuttle driver pulled up within a few minutes, loaded us up, and took off for the airport without going inside. So, if you intend to take the shuttle, wait outside for it. Shuttle arrives at the bottom and top of the hour. All in all, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: AnotherDawn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for a convention in town. We had a double with two double beds. The room was pretty standard but not up to what I would expect for a 3.5 star hotel. It was clean enough, a little worn around the edges but there was a great big red stain in the middle of the carpet. The room came with a tiny coffee pot but no fridge. Breakfast is not included in the room rate. Was not able to get a single solid night's sleep here. They have the tiniest double beds I have ever slept on, I'm an average size and my feet hung off the end of the bed. They have these huge puffy comforters on the bed, not normal blankets, and they were stiflingly hot. On top of that we could not adjust the temperature in our room, I don't know if it was broken or just disabled. Friends we traveled with had the same issue. The final kicker was the noise. Because you can get this hotel through Priceline and various discount services it attracts the kind of clientele that doesn't know how to behave in public places. We were woken up every night by very loud, rude people in the hallways, yelling and slamming doors. The walls at this place are paper thin, it was like they were in the room with us. Our travel companions had the same problem at the other end of the hotel, on a different floor, so it wasn't just one dipstick outside our room. On the positive side, the minimal interaction we had with staff was pleasant, the airport noise was almost non-existant (it's about half a mile from the airport) and it was very easy to get to from the highway. Still, I doubt we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: adt0312
Reviews.Content: Intended to tour the hotel regarding possible meeting plans in the Indy area. The hotel lobby was very busy upon check-in. Room was ok. Nice big King size bed. Bad view on third floor (just trees and a ventilation grate below). Airplanes are frequent and loud. I could hear EVERYTHING in the hallway. My shower had 2 temperatures...really hot and OMG really hot. The food in the sports bar was good but the atmosphere was very dark. 24 hour coffee shop is a treat. Meeting rooms (from peeking in) look adequate. Was unable to find the sales office to set up a more formal tour.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, comfortable, dated”
Reviews.Author: tabascoi812
Reviews.Content: We used the park n fly service this time. We like the bar - it's open later than others we know in the area. Our room was dated, but very comfortable. The shuttle came for us, even though it was about midnight .

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor, look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley8053
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 5 nights during a conference that was held on-site. When I saw the name Wyndham, I was optimistic, but upon arrival I quickly learned a well-known name brand does not a good hotel make. Check-in was a very slow process. Upon getting up to my room, the key they handed me did not work. I had to go back down to the desk, wait in line again, and after intense questioning about what I may have done to de-activate the card, they re-issued me a new key. The rooms themselves aren't terrible, but nothing extraordinary. There was a newer looking flat screen TV, but when I turned it on every channel was blurry with static. There is free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and conference center, but be warned, it is slower than dial-up! If you get 3G on your phone, you are better off just using that. The bedding is unusually short and if you stand taller than 5', your feet will most likely not be covered. They do provide Beth and Body Works products in the bathroom, which was nice. During the course of our stay, several other conference attendees complained about a nauseating sulfur smell coming from their bathroom. Luckily, I didn't experience it but from the complaints I heard, it was unbearable, and not resolved over the week we were there. The conference center itself was a pretty terrible experience. The meals they served were downright horrible. I've volunteered in soup kitchens which produced better meals than the Wyndham. The service throughout the hotel - check-in, restaurants, and conference center staff - was downright deplorable. The location provides NOTHING in walking distance so make sure sure you have a car. And speaking of location, there are plenty of other hotels in the area, if you need a place to stay, check out some other options!

Reviews.Title: “I would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stewbaker151
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in July 2011. We asked for a double. We were given a small room with two full size, not queen size, beds. The carpet was very stained and had a cigarette burn. The carpet in the hallways is newish, but not very plush. The swimming pool is outdoors. Although tripadvisor says the wireless internet works with I-Pad, I could not get it to work on mine. It worked on a Playbook, but was pretty slow. The hotel reminded me of a two star hotel, definitely not 3 and 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham in Name ONLY”
Reviews.Author: UndercoverAngel
Reviews.Content: Won this hotel on Priceline, but was a little leery seeing the reviews on here. My fears started to be realized when I called on Friday, July 1 (check-in day) to confirm my reservation and the phone wasn't answered (12 rings each time) the first two times that I called. Arrived and had a 5 minute wait to check in even though neither of the two people in front of me were checking in, the staff member seemed to have trouble answering the questions and the other woman at the desk was too busy talking to another employee to help me. I finally got to check in and was given a key to a room that was already occupied! Back down to the front desk where I told the clerk that the room was occupied, and she said NOTHING for about 20 seconds, before I finally got "I'm sorry for that". Got to the new room and it was OK, but had problems. The room had a faintly smoky smell, and the closet had a strange, musty smell, so much that I didn't use it. The free internet is wired and very slow. Carpets are ancient and the room as a whole is in need of renovations. I left the room at 10:45 AM Saturday morning, got back to the room around 1:30 AM Sunday morning to find that it hadn't been cleaned. When I called the desk to inform them, the clerk said "Well you probably had the DND sign out when she went by, and she didn't come back. We do have 400 rooms." I tried to get some sleep at this point, but the people from the horror convention started roaming the halls with no regard to noise level. I again had to call the front desk 3 times before getting an answer. Eventually, the noise did stop. As the title of my review states, this property is a Wyndham in name only. A more accurate description would be Motel 6. Do not stay here unless you like disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “William B. and staff are excellent! Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Min_KLThomas
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. I had a comfortable room with a great bed. It was quiet and clean. There were some restaurants and shopping within a decent vicinity. The grounds were well-kept as you'd expect from Wyndham. The most impressive part was that I left an expensive charger in the room and a member of the staff turned it in. I got a call telling me they're shipping it to me. What a staff and hotel! Great value for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just a disaster”
Reviews.Author: PDXmev
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Indy 500 and chose this hotel based on its proximity to the race track and airport. When we arrived, we found a line of 3 or 4 couples waiting to be helped by the front desk. After not being acknowledged by the obviously shellshocked front desk employees, we waited for another 30 minutes to actually talk to someone. The hotel had overbooked by about 10 rooms leaving us roomless; even though we had prepaid our rooms at least 4 months in advance. The staff seemed completely unempowered and checked out. At that point, their best suggestion was a hotel in Bloomington (an hour away).But at least they told us it was a long drive. Another customer came back into the hotel angry that the front desk had given him instructions to a hotel without telling him it was 50 miles away. At no time was I offered an apology. We were eventually able to stay in a friend's room that night but did end up staying at the hotel the night after (we had payed for two nights). My impression of the hotel only worsened upon sleeping there. The building is old and worn out. The exhaust fans in the bathrooms don't work. There was mold and peeling plaster both in the bathroom and the closet. One of the outlet covers even came out of the wall when I unplugged my laptop. Turning on the air conditioning caused an awful smell in the room. The walls are paper thin. So why am I giving this hotel just a poor rating? The sheets were clean and the restaurant and its staff were very good. You might have a better experience on a non-holiday weekend, but why take the chance?

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive, fast airport shuttle.”
Reviews.Author: mlsrar
Reviews.Content: Formerly the Adam's Mark, Wyndham is rebranding it as one of their products. Most of the elements remain the same, though they have updated the bedding. It is a bit outdated, but most of the staff remained, and they made the Adam's Mark a special place. The beds are comfortable, and the linens/bedding are new. The internet is fast, and free. The climate control was a bit finicky, and I'm not sure it ever adjusted to the temperature I wanted, though it wasn't inherently uncomfortable. (I like cooler rooms for sleeping) Pros: --Fast, frequent airport shuttle. --Fast Internet access (free too!) --Friendly Service --Quiet Cons: --Small-ish rooms --Limited Parking --Lots of construction in the area due to the I-70 reroute. A bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great for airport proximity, but don't leave anything behind”
Reviews.Author: Stellar424
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel itself was nice. My biggest disappointment was that I left some jewelry behind in my room and it was never "found." The hallway to get to our room was excessively long and smelled faintly of cigarette smoke, but our room itself was very nice and seemed recently updated. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room itself was large, although a little dark. The shower took several minutes to get hot water, but it did eventually warm up. We did the park and fly, as it is much cheaper than leaving your car at the airport. We came down to the shuttle 5 minutes before it was to leave, but it was already full. It would normally be another 30 minutes until the next shuttle, but the front desk was nice enough to have another shuttle get to us sooner. As I was going through security at the airport, I realized that I had left some jewelry in my hotel room. It was cheap jewelry from the mall, but it was my favorite. I called as soon as I realized (at 5:30 in the morning, only an hour after checking out) and the woman I spoke with said they would look for it and hold it for me until I returned. When we got back from our vacation, the woman at the front desk seemed irritated that I was asking about my jewelry. She called security to see if they had it, but whoever was working security did not have access to the safe where they store those sorts of things. I gave them my phone number to call me when they found it. Three days went by, nobody called me, so I called and was transferred to security where I left a message. 2 days later, they returned my call to say that they couldn't find my jewelry. I knew exactly where I left it and I highly doubt housekeeping had gotten to my room by the time I called, so obviously nobody cared enough to hold onto my jewelry for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: wrenchgal
Reviews.Content: Wonderful night spent here! The room was updated and very clean and the beds comfortable. Right by the airport and interstate but very little noise. There could have been better signage directing people to the elevators, pool, etc but we found our way. We will definitely stay here again. The pool isn't designed for small kids, it's 4 to 6 feet deep so that was a little disappointing but the kids still enjoyed it after a hot day at the car show. We found the high speed internet to be a little slow but it served it's purpose. I wouldn't hesitate to book here again, efficient check in, modern and clean rooms and a good night's sleep. It is a drive to get to places to eat, but only maybe 8 or 10 miles and there are plenty of options.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: amynmik
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here overnight on may 20th and left car as we flew to dominican republic. Upon our return on May 28th our flight was delayed. I called the hotel at 8 pm and made sure this wouldn't be a problem. After they asked my name they reassured me that we would have no problem. Arrived at airport and called for shuttle at 5 after midnight to which a rather rude woman answered the phone and told me I needed to get to the right pick up spot (not explaining how to get to it). After waiting 40 minutes I called the hotel and recieved no answer. We then realized we were in the wrong spot and walked quite a ways to the correct spot and called the hotel back. They were very nice at this point and sent the shuttle to us. Upon arrival to the hotel it seemed something was up. The woman is staring at her computer as I stand there and wait (only person in lobby) she then tells me it will be just a minute and goes to talk to the woman in the back room and comes to tell me they have a situation. well, the situation is it is Indy 500 and they had overbooked and had no rooms. I had booked and paid for this room months ago! Nobody mentioned this when I called from Philly! They informed me it had been a rough night ( hello, what about my night) and they had to place people as far away as bloomington (no clue how far this was away and didnt really care). I remained call but had been up and traveling since 5 am in another country and told them I really needed a shower and a bed. they did say due to the hour they did find me something but it doesnt have a tv. I said that is fine as we really arent going to be turning a tv on. well, i will now discribe the room. first, the keys didnt work because this isnt a room they use for people. they gave us keys but luckily security caught us in the hall and informed us they won't work. This room was at total other side of building, maintenance vacumming room upon arrival. supposed to be 2 beds but has one double bed and not the same beds we slept in a week ago. sitting on a wood base that can be seen. No cozy pillowtop thing. They did bring a scarey looking rollaway bed in with no blankets. No pillows in the room. When I called the front desk to ask for pillows and blankets she stated "maam, we are totally booked, we don't have any pillows". I then states this is ridiculous and hung up the phone and got in the shower. while showering they brought a blanket in but no pillows. We then all 3 went to bed with no pillows, alarm clock, trash cans, coffee maker, tv or THERMOSTAT. After laying in the bed the phone rang and I did not answer it, my gosh we are EXHAUSTED! About 20 minutes later someone knocked on the door for several minutes. ok, I know you might not want to know this but we brought in close for the next day and I admit we were all sleeping naked. Do you really want me answering the door at 2:30, 3 am in the morning naked and no way am I answering it. About a half hour later more knocking. They had given us 3 free breakfast buffet passes that we could use till 10 am but hello, we were sleeping. We got up and threw cloths on and gave our keys and passes back to the front desk. They did question us not using the passes like that would make everything better. when I mentioned the pillows she stated well, they did try to bring you some in the night. I said we were sleeping! They had borrowed 2 from another hotel.So, which person doesn't get a pillow. I am not impressed and yes everyone I know has heard this story in person, phone and facebook. It is so disappointing and I am upset the the staff didnt seem very upset by putting someone in this situation. So, I paid full price for this place!!!! Crazy! Did they really think I wouldn't come back and pick up my car?

Reviews.Title: “Something changed and it was not good”
Reviews.Author: jamesinnjBrunswick
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Wyndham three months ago. It was a nice hotel, a little busy but I understood. When I was there last I was invited by one of the managers to leave a tripadvisor rating. I never got around to it, frankly I forgot. My company sent me back to Indianapolis for a follow up so I decided to go back to Wyndham this month. NOBODY WORKS THERE! Not that the poor souls who were trying to take care of the customers were not trying, they were. But there was no staff to be found. My room did not get cleaned until 4:30 in the afternoon and the parking lot was fairly empty. I never saw more than one person at the front office and when I went to dinner the same person who was seating at the front door was waiting tables. I did see a bartender but only one, serving at least 20 people in the bar. The parking area did not have many cars but it did have a great amount of trash and garbage and there was no lighting which is probably not good because I heard someone complaining at the desk about his car being broken into. It is a sad state of management which would let what could be a nice hotel have such poor service as to have no presence. This hotel went downhill fast. I forgot to leave my review a few months ago but I joined tripadvisor just to let the manager of this hotel know how disappointing a job he or she is doing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: johnnyhboy
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to thank the staff for all of their help. The front desk, housekeeping, maintenance... My experience was flawless.. Very nice and helpful staff.. Thanks to all of you

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd have stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Sssc1969
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a nice place. The ceiling in the bathroom is moldy and the paint peeling. Only half of the television channels come in. The wireless Internet connection is the slowest I've encountered and crashes frequently. The refrigerator that costs extra does not work. I could keep giong. Very poor. Lots of other hotels in the area, choose one of them first!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A series of small annoyances.”
Reviews.Author: MGinCT
Reviews.Content: Plenty of issues. First room: room key didn't work well and shower drain did not work. Second room: wireless internet signal did not work - a big problem for business or personal travelers. Check-in was unfriendly, inefficient and confused. The two on staff seemed more interested in talking to each other than to checking me in. Rooms seem clean and in decent shape. Hotel is close to the airport, and the planes seemed very, very loud at 3am. I wouldn't recommend this place, but I've stayed in worse. Management would do well to send the front desk to intensive friendliness seminars, fix the internet and other issues, but experience suggests that those problems often originate with management. As I write this (from the lobbey; internet doesn't work in my room), I hear the front desk sending someone up for door issues.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our 4 night stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dorjean
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, nicely furnished, and fairly quiet. Also, we caught their airport shuttle to the hotel and return to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel at a very reasonable rate!”
Reviews.Author: GWIND
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very easy to get to as it is very near the old airport. That is probably the reason for the exceptional rates. It is just a few miles from the new airport. I found the staff to be very accommodating and helpful, very friendly! The conference are was very nice as well. Room was pleasant and there was free WiFi! Although I didn't eat in one of the Hotel's restaurants, I did have several meals that were catered by the Hotel and they were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “If only every Somalier and General Manager were so nice”
Reviews.Author: likeswine00
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wyndham while on business in Indianapolis. I was exhausted and frustrated when I arrived, after a long plane ride. After checking in and getting settled, I immediately went to the bar for a glass of wine. Not only was I greated with a smile by the bartender, when I asked for a specific wine I was immediately introduced to a wonderful man(DAVE) , the somalier,who told me all about their wines and led me to a great wine. It was just what I needed after a long day. I got up after a terrific night sleep. The bed was very comfortable. The only issue I had with the room is that I couldnt get the temperature regulated. It was either hot or cold. That morning the staff was very busy, I saw one man in particular that was greating people, making sure the hotel van was at the door for a group of pilots and air line attendants and then later I saw him in the resteraunt waiting tables. I thought my job was taxing. I had the pleasure of meeting this man at the end of my trip. I must have looked confused because the man who was doing everything the morning before asked me if I needed assistance. I almost forgot that I was in Indiana because he had a great southern accent with southern manners. I had been looking for a news paper ( you dont automatically get one at your door, that was a bummer.) Bill, who I found out was the General Manager , and the man doing about 5 jobs at once, went and got me a newspaper for my flight home. Between Dave and Bill ,they are two very good reasons you would want to visit this hotel ( The beds are nice too). I wish every somalier and general manager were so nice. Usually General Managers walk around just saying Hi and smiling. Bill was friendly and he was helpful. Dave was informative, friendly and pleasant to talk to. I have two suggestions, please add some healthy meals(alternatives) to your menus. It is very hard to eat well when traveling. Many hotels are trying to help by adding lower calorie alternatives and meals. Also, is there anything you can do about your prices for food, they are high. I went down town one night for dinner and it was half the cost of dinner at the hotel (yes, I ate very simimlar at the hotel and at the resteraunt down town). Just a thought. Thank you A tired business traveler

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: anmjg2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located off of the interstate in a cluster of other hotels. The rooms seemed quite clean and quiet (except for the occasional plane overhead). We purchased through Hotwire so did not realize that the pool was an outdoor pool. The wireless internet does not work with ipads, ipods, or iphones as the front desk informed me upon check in. Odd but it has something to do with log-in screens. If I was traveling alone, I'd probably stay again but, with children, I would have preferred to stay at a place with free breakfast. Nevertheless, that is my issue in booking this hotel and not the hotel's issue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Very Clean. Friendly”
Reviews.Author: osumom31
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. Called at 1am, wanting to move from another hotel, and they were very friendly and accommodating. Randi at front desk was so helpful!! She saved out trip from being ruined! Hotel is very quiet, you don't hear hall noise our upstair noise!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased and thankful!”
Reviews.Author: helpfulhoney
Reviews.Content: We stayed here New year's Eve and had a wonderful time. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Even drew us a map finding a place for breakfast on the road home New Year's Day. I had left a piece of clothing in our room but did not realize it until over a week later. Bill in Secuirty (Lost & Found) was very helpful and mailed my once lost article back home to me! So pleased and thankful for his help and the housemaid's honesty. Thank you Wyndham!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: TakeMeHome2
Reviews.Content: I travel allot. This week alone I'll be in Long Beach, Phoenix, St. Paul, Milwaukee, and Indy. I've stayed in a wide variety of hotels across the nation. Rarely do I post a review but I was walking back to my room and saw this computer crying out for attention. 1st - I arrived a bit late (7 pm) and this place is DARK. I mean really dark. The hotel parking lot is quite large and is seriously lacking adequate lighting. I'm a middle aged man and a big guy. I felt a bit uncomfortable walking from my car to the hotel entrance. The darkness doesn't stop there either. I entered my room and it was DARK. Really, really dark. There were no light switches on the wall near the door. I entered the room and the door shut behind me leaving me to try and find a light switch. I couldn't. In fact, I had to prop the door open with my luggage so some light from the hall would shine in the room so I could locate a lamp clear across the room. I must say that once the lights came on, I was impressed on how large the room was. Neat, clean, and big. Nice. 2nd - The attached restaurant was a huge disappointment. Service was miserable. They ended up getting 2 of the 4 things I ordered wrong. My soup never came. The waiter seemed more concerned with socializing with his colleagues than servicing his tables. When I mentioned the discrepancies with my order I was told I wouldn't be charged for the items missing and that was it. No apology, no discount, no nothing. I made a little fuss over it and they ended up taking off $1.50 form my $35 bill. Whippdy Dooo. Not what I expect from a Wyndham. I must stay that the rate I got was great and well below my expectations. Front desk was pleasant and quick. But considering the accommodations and service thus far, I would have gladly paid a few extra dollars to be treated a little better and not have to worry about my vehicle sitting in the dark outside. Nighty- night!

Reviews.Title: “"Wedding cake"”
Reviews.Author: mdmacke
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to Chef Anthony Puma for providing 2 (!) wedding cakes per my request as a surprise to my wife on our first night at the Wyndham after our wedding. In fact, she carried one of the cakes to California where it was shared with several others. My favorite was the apple-spice cake; she liked the blueberry cake the best. Both were very pretty as well as tasty. Our photos will show forever this very nice gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly and very clean with fabulous beds!”
Reviews.Author: IndyMedicine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights with my Golden Retriever. They honored their policy about dogs (a small deposit up front) and placed me in a room near an exit on a lower floor as requested so I could walk my dog as needed. You would never know this is a pet-friendly hotel; the rooms are clean and the property is well-kept. The best part of my room was the bed--it was fabulous! It rivals any bed in a much more expensive hotel. The bed is filled with pillows and comforters and makes you feel like you could stay in it all day. The hotel is off the interstate (very convenient), but you do not hear it. For the money, this hotel is a wonderful value and I will always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we thought for being next to the airport”
Reviews.Author: rafferty2204
Reviews.Content: On our arrival, we were greated fast and friendly. Check in took just a few minutes and our room was very nice and clean. We were on the side with the Interstate, but with the windows, we never heard anything once we fell asleep. Our bed was remade every day and we were always greated when we walked in the door. We will be staying again next year if the pricesare still as good as they were this year.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Vikyrodri_07
Reviews.Content: The beds were comfy and the room was clean! A little outdated but we had a nice stay! Also, a little far from everything but for the price it was good!

Reviews.Title: “Trash on the floor and duct tape on the cracked window . . .”
Reviews.Author: lgoeppn
Reviews.Content: Not impressed at all! The floor in the corners and around the night stand was dusty, obviously not cleaned. There was a safety pin by the nightstand in addition to the dust, a huge sticky cough drop right in front of the window and a plastic collar support (from a new men's dress shirt) in the corner. The toilet flapper stuck and would keep running until you jiggled the handle. The window, which BTW overlooked a wall, had two large pieces of good old duct tape to support a crack in the glass. And if that wasn't enough there was some event going on and unattended children were allowed to roam the halls without supervision. The oldest in the group was about 9 years old These kids were shaking their rear ends when the elevator doors opened then they'd hit every button on the elevator before they finally got out. Our complaints at check-out got only an insincere apology. Obviously customer service and housekeeping are not high on this hotel's list of priorities. I'd have taken photos if I'd known I could upload them to the review.

Reviews.Title: “Perplexing price match guarantee and a very poor room”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner_10
Reviews.Content: Needed a room for just one weekend night and was okay with the airport area so did a general search. Quickly found a good rate on one of the Internet sites and called Wyndham to book the room. The Wyndham 800 number said they were not allowed to match internet pricing (even though their website has a clearly stated price match plus guarantee.) So I booked through the 3rd party site. The room had things wrong that you simply shouldn't find in a 3 1/2 star hotel. Paint was peeling from the ceilings in the hall and bathroom. The bathroom door was so warped, it couldn't be closed. The shower handle fell off in my hand. There were suspect red stains on the carpet in a couple places. Chunks of grout were missing in the shower tiles. When I shared the above with the desk, they said that the 800 number can not price match, only the individual property??? As to the defects, they simply shrugged and said Operations would look into it.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: schicksa
Reviews.Content: I was sent to the Wyndham after a late night flight was cancelled. The staff were very friendly and fast, and the room was clean and very nice. Exceeded my expectations for a hotel working with us on vouchers from the airline! Bed was super comfortable. It was so nice to be treated so well after such a horrible evening with awful airline service. This hotel was the one thing Delta did right!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the only good part of my day”
Reviews.Author: rowan1204
Reviews.Content: I ended up at the Wyndham due to a fiasco of flight cancellations, late arrivals, and missed connections, so my stay was being comped by the airline. By the time I arrived at the Wyndham I was cranky, sweaty, and generaly prepared to hate the world. That state wasn't helped by knowing that I had to be at the airport the following morning at 4:00 am in order to catch my re-assigned flight. The fact that the Wyndham Indianapolis West turned things around for me says it all. First, I obviously arrived with no reservation, expecting to get a standard room with two double or queen beds. The woman at the desk was friendly, professional, and I was delighted to find that I had a king bed with a mattress that was like a little bit of heaven. The rooms was smallish, but very clean, quiet, and well laid out. I used the shampoo and conditioner when I showered - something I rarely do, being very fussy about hair products - and I was surprised to find they were actually good! Already, I was happy to be at the Wyndham. I ventured down to dinner, airline food vouchers in hand. The hotel restaurant had a buffet (this was a Friday night) that was excellent and very well priced. For just under $20 there was a sizeable salad bar, a variety of entrees, and a number of side dishes to choose from. The waiter suggested trying the dessert (included in the buffet) and the cheesecake was really excellent. If I had the cheesecake first, I might have gone for a dessert-only meal, since the other choices looked just as good. I have to note that this isn't a buffet with endless mediocre dishes. Instead, the selection is quite good and attention to quality is obviously a high priority. To top it off, when I asked for a desperately needed glass of wine, I was introduced to the sommelier. At an airport hotel! This gentleman was clearly knowledgeable about wines and happy to share information about the choices. I dropped off to sleep on that lovely mattress, having verified that a shuttle would be available at the ongodly hour of 3:30 am. Guess what? The shuttle was right on time and got me to the airport without incident. I travel often for business and pleasure, and have stayed at a wide variety of expensive properties in cities and at destination locations. For friendly service and a host of unexpected and most welcome bonuses, the Wyndham is a place I would return to if I ever need to stay near the Indy airport. My advice? If you think your airline is going to leave you stranded, try to get to Indianapolis and insist on the Wyndham! I didn't check out the pool or other amenities, so if you're interested in things other than good food and wine, a superbly comfortable bed, and friendly, professional service, you'll need to check other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for airport and downtown”
Reviews.Author: dfbf
Reviews.Content: The room was standard design and was clean. There is a gift shop and expensive restaurant on the premises, but the surrounding area is industrial, leaving few alternatives without a car. The location is excellent for both downtown and the airport. The staff was cooperative and gave me a excellent rate during a busy time in the area. I would stay here again if the price was competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Super Convenient to Downtown Indy -- Super Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: MSUTigerShark
Reviews.Content: We came to Indianapolis for the Final Four. This city is a great location for this type of event. Unable to get a reservation in a downtown hotel, we made a reservation at the Wyndham just as a back up while still hoping for something downtown. Finally on check in day I called the Wyndham to verify cancellation time. The agent I spoke to was so helpful (Allison?) that I really questioned whether or not to spend an additional $120-$180 per night more for downtown. So, at the last minute we decided to keep our spot at the Wyndham. Check in was quick, parking free. I believe that the hotel was near capacity, but did not seem crowded or hectic. The room was nice and clean and quiet and the bed very comfortable. Free wireless internet was much appreciated, as was the nice flat screen TV. We did spend a lot of time in downtown Indy. Our commute to and from the Wyndham could not have been easier. A quick walk to the car and easy on and off the expressway and we were there--10 to 15 minutes and we were right in the middle of the action. The only negative was non-functioning ice machines at the far end of our floor and the one below. Did get ice two floors below. I thought maybe they were just overtaxed due to the fullness of the hotel, but they didn't work the next day either. Other than that one problem all was great!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect End to a busy Weekend”
Reviews.Author: courtcro
Reviews.Content: I had just finished a tiring weekend of volleyball downtown, and my mother and I were looking to find a hotel with easy access to the airport with good rates, and somewhat luxurious. The desk staff was very friendly, and when we left without a map to go to the airport, the desk clerk even ran out to our car to give one to us! Most wouldn't go to such lengths. The rooms were very spacious, and the TV's were nice, large flat screens. Although the restaurants looked very nice, from what I could see, we didn't eat there because we were too exhausted. We did, however, order pizza from the restaurant, and it was probably one of the best pizzas I had ever eaten. It was reasonably priced too. The best parts were the beds. I've stayed at some very, very luxurious hotels all over the country, but I have never had such comfortable beds. Overall, this is a great hotel, and I will definitely stay there if I am ever in Indianapolis again!

Reviews.Title: “I particularly liked the friendliness of the front office staff.”
Reviews.Author: traveler73Indiana
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel primarily for the convenience and the ability to leave my car while I was on a trip. I stayed only two nights, one before the trip and the night that I returned so I didn't use many of the facilities. The room was wonderful and the bed FANTASTIC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Fendo007
Reviews.Content: Great Experience. Great time. We were there for a State Dart Championship. The staff was great and the hotel was clean. I would definately stay there again even for other reasons (other than darts).

Reviews.Title: “park & fly”
Reviews.Author: boliver5382
Reviews.Content: excellent time,good food,liked the 24 hour service to airport which was our deciding factor in staying at Wyndham. we would stay againg on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay-felt like a Queen!”
Reviews.Author: Bushy55
Reviews.Content: Very easy to get to-great place for Park& Fly. I had room service it was the best home made Pizza I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Bed”
Reviews.Author: dpalmer5
Reviews.Content: You would think a comfortable mattress and clean rooms would be the norm in a hotel but I have found that not to be the case. When I find a hotel that provides them I am thrilled. This hotel provided that for me. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Indianapolis West”
Reviews.Author: muchoqueso
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay and experienced no problems. I've stayed at many hotels before, but this hotel really has a certain charm to it. When you first walk in you are welcomed by a friendly staff that is helpful with getting you and your belongings to your room. The hotel was very clean and it felt safe as well. I went outside a couple times and noticed security patroling the parking lot which was good to see. I experienced no problems with logging onto the internet from my room even though I was on the 5th floor. It was very easy. The bed was very comfortable as well. I had a good night sleep in it. The pillows were very soft which I liked. The front desk did not forget my wake up call either which was great! No complaints of my stay. If I could recommend anything to this hotel, it would be for a list of the tv stations in the room to easily find the station you're looking for!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: willfortwayne
Reviews.Content: The room was very warm and clean. Service was excellent and friendly. The shuttle to and from the airport was on time and convienent. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Wyndham was a very welcoming place to stay with a staff who went above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: ltanguay
Reviews.Content: Your staff was wonderful. Everyone I encounter went beyond the call of duty to help me and make me feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent convention facility”
Reviews.Author: Lakeside12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 10/28-10/31 for a convention. The hotel went out of their way to accommodate us. The staff was always helpful, especially a smiling young woman who seemed to be on duty 24 hours a day. I wish I had gotten her name because she deserves special thanks. Breakfast and lunch service was set up for us in a large room with tables, a nice touch that allowed us to take a break and visit. Our hospitality room was large and we even had an overflow room. Bedrooms were spotless and most of all quiet since we had to be up very early. They do not use fitted sheets which can be a problem for restless sleepers and the tubs seemed very high to step into for some of our older people. The only pool is outside but we would not have used it anyway. Service in the restaurant was very slow on the days we were there causing some to miss scheduled activities. Finding a good hotel with the right amount of space at a good price is difficult. All in all we were pleased with the Wyndham West.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Bob0611
Reviews.Content: November 4, 2009 Dear Wyndham Staff, We are writing to tell you about an outstanding Wyndham Indianapolis West employee. Late Monday afternoon on October 25th, Leroy picked us up at the Indianapolis airport. We were tired after a long, multi-flight trip from Seattle. Our spirits were lifted immediately, however, by Leroy, a warm and friendly man who mentioned that this was his last trip of the day. He said he was particularly looking forward to going home that evening because his daughter and grandchild would be there, and his daughter was preparing a special dinner for the family. When we arrived at the Wyndham, my husband realized that he had left his brief case, which contained his computer and car keys, at the passenger pickup area. Without hesitation, Leroy informed his boss about the situation and immediately decided to make another run to the airport. “What about your special dinner?” we asked. “Oh, that’s not as important as you getting your brief case,” Leroy responded with a big smile. Upon arrival at the airport, a person in the pickup area told Leroy that the brief case had been found and turned over to airport security personnel. They had already taken the bag to a safe place, opened it, found my husband’s business card, and were attempting to get in touch with him. So we ended our trip, being very thankful to recover our bag and for an incredible man named Leroy. We commend him for his kindness, thoughtfulness and extraordinary customer service. We hope you will, too! Sincerely, Bob and Sherrie Eldridge

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: BirdsIndiana
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to catch a flight out from Indy airport. Did the park, sleep, fly. Very friendly staff. Dropped us off right at our location to fly out. Picked us up for our return. Didn't have to wait over 5 min. when returned from our flight to take us back to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated? I don't think so. Not new.”
Reviews.Author: Psychedelicious
Reviews.Content: I booked this Wyndham because I like Wyndham rooms. This is not a real Wyndham, it's an old hotel that got a partial makeover. Rooms have nice TV but furniture looks like grandma's house. There was a musty smell in the halls, and the pool was closed. The bar was dark and the staff seemed unhappy. The hotel itself was almost empty of both guests and staff, kind of creepy. The food was terrible, especially since I ordered based on the waiters suggestion. I hope this isn't the future of Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eouw0o83hf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got stuck at Indianapolis International Airport for a night due to a canceled flight. We talked to some helpful people at the airport information desk who gave us a coupon for a discounted rate for travelers stuck at the airport. The hotel provided a free 24-hour shuttle service which we used a few times (had to go back to pick up a bag), and it was very reliable (went back and forth twice an hour). This service was very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: squirrelfriend
Reviews.Content: Stayed here via Priceline to attend an event at the Lucas Oil Stadium. The hotel was a short drive to the downtown area. I requested double beds and had no problems. The rooms seemed average size to me with outdated furniture, but a fantastic bed. I swear it was one of the softest hotel beds I've ever had and I travel frequently. The towels were very large and fluffy also. Flat screen TV was nice. We didn't eat in the restaurant and I was a little disappointed with the lack of a fitness center. The hotel is in the process of becoming a Wyndham. The front desk staff was very helpful with directions and assistance with area restaurants. We would definitely return.
